title: Stenodema calcarata
text:
Stenodema calcarata is a species of <a href="insect">bug</a> from <a href="Miridae">Miridae</a> family, that can be found in <a href="Europe">Europe</a> and across the <a href="Palearctic">Palearctic</a> to <a href="Central%20Asia">Central Asia</a>, the <a href="Russian%20Far%20East">Russian Far East</a>, <a href="Siberia">Siberia</a>, northern <a href="China">China</a>, <a href="Korea">Korea</a> and <a href="Japan">Japan</a>.
Description.
The length of an <a href="adult">adult</a> is , and have a longitudinal furrow between the eyes.
Ecology.
"Stenodema calcarata" lives on grasses including "<a href="Agrostis%20tenuis">Agrostis tenuis</a>", "<a href="Alopecurus%20pratensis">Alopecurus pratensis</a>", "<a href="Festuca">Festuca</a>" and in bogs "<a href="Molinia%20caerulea">Molinia caerulea</a>" and many other grasses (Poaceae), and also on (Cyperaceae) and (Juncaceae), such as sedges "<a href="Carex">Carex</a>", "<a href="Scirpus">Scirpus</a>" and "<a href="Juncus">Juncus</a>". 
The species <a href="hibernate">hibernate</a>s in <a href="winter">winter</a>, and come aground in April. During this time, the females start to change colour to <a href="green">green</a>, while males still remain <a href="yellow">yellow</a>, or <a href="brown">brown</a>. The <a href="larva">larva</a>e appears by August.
